intro: Cuphea graciliflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered cuphea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. Cuphea graciliflora is often cultivated as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
